verses.verse: At that time Herod the tetrarch heard about the fame of Jesus,
and said to his servants, "This is John the Baptist. He is risen from the dead, and that's how these miracles are brought about by him."
For Herod had taken hold of John, tied him up, and put him in prison because of Heroidias, his brother Philip's wife.
Because John had said to him, "It is not lawful for you to have her."
When he wanted to kill him, he was scared of the multitude, because they considered him to be a prophet.
But when Herod's birthday was celebrated, Herodias' daughter danced in front of them and pleased Herod.
That's why he promised with an oath to give her whatever she might ask.
Instructed beforehand by her mother, she said, "Give me right here the head of John the Baptist on a plate."
And king was grieved, nevertheless because of the oath and those who sat with him for the meal, he commanded it to be given her.
He sent and beheaded John in the prison.
Then his head was brought on a plate and given to the girl, and she brought it to her mother.
His disciples then came, picked up the body, buried it, and went and told Jesus.
When Jesus heart about it, he left there by ship to a deserted place by himself. When the people heard about it, they followed him on foot out of the cities.
Jesus went out and saw a large crowd; he was moved with compassion for them and healed their sick.
When it was evening, his disciples came to him saying, "This is a desolate place, and it is long past time. Send the crowd away, so they can go into the villages and buy food for themselves."
But Jesus said to them, "They don't need to leave; you give them [food] to eat."
They said to him, "We have here only five loaves and two fish."
He said, "Bring them here to me."

He commanded the crowd to sit down on the grass, took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up into heaven, he blessed, broke, and gave to the disciples, and the disciples gave to the multitude.
They all ate and were satisfied, then they picked up the pieces that were left--twelve baskets full!
Those who ate were around five thousand men excluding women and children.
Jesus immediately made his disciples get into a ship and to go before him to the other side, while he sent the crowd away.
After he sent the crowd away, he went up a mountain alone to pray, and when evening had come, he was there alone.
Meanwhile the ship was now in the midst of the sea tossed about by the waves, for the wind was against them.
In the fourth watch of the night, Jesus went to them walking on the sea.
When the disciples saw him walking on the sea, they were very uneasy saying, "It is a ghost;" and they screamed in fear.
But Jesus immediately spoke to them, saying, "Be of good cheer; it is I. Don't be afraid."
Peter answered him and said, "Lord, if it is you, order me to come to you on the water."
Then he said, "Come." After Peter had stepped out of the ship, he walked on the water to go to Jesus.
But when he saw the howling wind, he was scared and starting to sink, he shouted saying, "Lord, save me."
Immediately Jesus stretched out his hand, caught him, and said to him, "O you little-faith, why did you doubt?"
When they got into the ship, the wind stopped.
Those who were in the ship came and worshiped him, saying, "Truly you are the Son of God."
After they had crossed over, they came to the land of Gennesaret.
When the men of that place recognized him, they sent out to all the surrounding region and brought all who were diseased to him,
and begged him that they might only touch the hem of his garment, and as many as touched were made perfectly well.
